pr_title: Modify !coreinfo command to output the "java.vm.name" property of a core file

timeline.bodyText:
I suggest this should be presented (on one line) like JAVA VM VERSION:
out.println("JAVA VM NAME\t- " + properties.get("java.vm.name"));
timeline.author: keithc-ca

replies.bodyText:
Please note the space after -.
Also, I didn't mean to suggest you add the redundant newline ("\n").
replies.author: keithc-ca

replies.bodyText: Modified to have it presented on one line
replies.author: dusanboskovic

replies.bodyText: I was copying the format of the JAVA VM VERSION as I switched from a newline to a tab for JAVA VM NAME. Will revert back
replies.author: dusanboskovic

timeline.message:
Modify coreinfo command to output the java.vm.name property of a core file

Signed-off-by: Dusan-Boskovic <dusan.boskovic@ibm.com>

Modify coreinfo command to output the java.vm.name property of a core file

Signed-off-by: Dusan-Boskovic <dusan.boskovic@ibm.com>

Modify coreinfo command to output the java.vm.name property of a core file

Signed-off-by: Dusan-Boskovic <dusan.boskovic@ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: There used to be a blank line between the JAVA SERVICE LEVEL INFO section and the PLATFORM INFO section, but with the removal of the  + "\n" that blank line is gone.
timeline.author: pshipton

replies.bodyText: I also note the pre-existing code using \n isn't correct. It should be using System.getProperty("line.separator") or out.println();.
replies.author: pshipton

replies.bodyText: I'll open a pull request to clean that up later today.
replies.author: keithc-ca

replies.bodyText: @dusanboskovic was working on something, pls check with him.
replies.author: pshipton

replies.bodyText: @keithc-ca Peter and I were speaking about this last night. I can open a new PR today that will clean up the "\n" and reintroduce a new blank line after the "JAVA VM NAME" section
replies.author: dusanboskovic

replies.bodyText: I don't think the blank line after 'JAVA VM NAME' is significant; I think it's just a stylistic preference (that I'm fine with either way).
replies.author: keithc-ca

replies.bodyText:
There were/are sections in the output which are separated with blank lines. The blank line between two sections was removed, while there is still a blank line between other sections. I think removing the blank line makes the output a little harder to read.
This is what it looks like now, without a blank line before PLATFORM INFO.
COMMANDLINE
bin/java -Xdump:system:events=vmstop

JAVA SERVICE LEVEL INFO
JRE 1.8.0 Linux amd64-64 (build 8.0.7.0 - pxa6480sr7-20200922_01(SR7))
JAVA VERSION INFO
JRE 1.8.0 Linux amd64-64-Bit Compressed References 20201006_456922 (JIT enabled, AOT enabled)
OpenJ9   - a12d134
OMR      - 738adf7
IBM      - 712c984
JAVA VM VERSION	- 2.9
JAVA VM NAME	- IBM J9 VM
PLATFORM INFO
Platform Name :	LINUX 64Bit
OS Level	: Linux 3.10.0-693.1.1.el7.x86_64
Processors -
  Architecture	: amd64
  How Many	: 2
replies.author: pshipton

replies.bodyText: I think a blank line would be (more) welcome before 'JAVA VM VERSION' to make the end of 'JAVA VERSION INFO' more visible.
replies.author: keithc-ca

replies.bodyText:
I am looking at it now, an I think it would be best if it was reordered. Adding a blank line before 'JAVA VM VERSION' makes it seem chopped. How does something like this look
JAVA VM NAME	- IBM J9 VM
JAVA VM VERSION	- 2.9
JAVA SERVICE LEVEL INFO
JRE 1.8.0 Linux amd64-64 (build 8.0.7.0 - pxa6480sr7-20200922_01(SR7))
JAVA VERSION INFO
JRE 1.8.0 Linux amd64-64-Bit Compressed References 20201006_456922 (JIT enabled, AOT enabled)
OpenJ9   - a12d134
OMR      - 738adf7
IBM      - 712c984

PLATFORM INFO
Platform Name :	LINUX 64Bit
OS Level	: Linux 3.10.0-693.1.1.el7.x86_64
Processors -
  Architecture	: amd64
  How Many	: 2
replies.author: dusanboskovic
